title: AAQ: If we belong to the spiritual world, why did Krishna send us here ? | HH Stoka Krishna Swami
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Krishna has not sent us here. We have come here.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that we come to the material world due to our desire to enjoy independently of Krishna and to lord over others.

segments.key_quote: Here everyone is trying to be the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the spiritual world, where Krishna is the undisputed Lord, with the material world, where everyone seeks to be a lord in their own domain, influenced by their karma.

segments.key_quote: Even Brahma doesn't have the power to lord over everyone like Krishna lords over.
segments.summary: The speaker uses Brahma as an example of someone with significant power in the material world, but who is still subject to the laws of material nature and not truly independent.

segments.key_quote: Brahma has got a fantastic long life span. The longest life span anybody can ever have.
segments.summary: The speaker details the immense lifespan of Brahma, emphasizing that even he is subject to time and death, and uses the analogy of a 50-year-old person to illustrate Brahma's perspective.

segments.key_quote: Actually we are spirit soul. We are no death.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that we are eternal spirit souls, but our identification with the body leads to illusion and the experience of material existence, influenced by the three gunas.

segments.key_quote: We are completely under control. But we think we are free.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that we are under the control of the three gunas, despite thinking we are independent, and that all material bodies, including Brahma's, are subject to death.
